abstract: General Electric reports fourth-quarter jump in net income to $5.2 billion, increase of 61 percent from year-ago quarter; revenue rose 4 percent to $42 billion; company has shifted its focus to its industrial business and away from finance.
lead_paragraph: As the company returns to its roots as a maker of industrial products like jet engines and medical equipment, it has pared back its finance arm.
snippet: As the company returns to its roots as a maker of industrial products like jet engines and medical equipment, it has pared back its finance arm.

headline.main: G.E. Profit Rises as It Puts a Stronger Focus on Its Industrial Business
headline.print_headline: G.E. Profit Rises as It Puts a Stronger Focus on Its Industrial Business
